Other Meetings of Interest to Institute Members
Sunday, April 28, 8 p.m., Room 216, Deshler-Wallick Hotel. Din¬
ner for educational directors of stations affiliated with the Columbia
Broadcasting System. Sterling Fisher, CBS Educational Director, Host.
Sunday, April 28, 9 p.m., Deshler-Wallick Hotel. Educational
directors of stations affiliated with the National Broadcasting Company.
Walter G. Preston, Jr., Assistant to the Vice President in Charge of Pro¬
grams, Host.
Monday, April 29, 12:30 p.m., Deshler-Wallick Hotel. Luncheon
for members of Advisory Committee of the Institute of Oral and Visual
Education and invited guests. Howard M. LeSourd, Chairman, Host.
Monday, April 29, 5 p.m., Room 1212, Deshler-Wallick Hotel.
Reception of CBS educational directors and other invited guests. Sta¬
tion WBNS, Educational Department, Irwin Johnson, Director, Host.
Monday, April 29, 5 p.m., Hall of Mirrors, Deshler-Wallick
Hotel. Members of the Institute are invited to a special showing of a
sound color film of the Interlochen Music Camp. The Camp has a num¬
ber of radio activities which should be of interest. Joseph Maddy, Host.
Tuesday, April 30, 12:30 p.m., Room 216, Deshler-Wallick Hotel.
Luncheon for school directors of radio. William D. Boutwell, Director,
Radio Project, United States Office of Education, in charge.
Tuesday, April 30, 4:45-5:15 p.m., Parlors A and B, Deshler-
Wallick Hotel. Members of the Institute are invited to attend a dem¬
onstration of frequency modulation. Courtesy Station WBNS-W8XVH.
Wednesday, May i, 6 p.m., Station WHKC Studios, 22 East Gay
Street. Members of the Institute are invited to witness a broadcast from
6:15 to 6:30, to the Mutual Broadcasting System, of “Trail Blazers,” a
dramatized safety program of the American Automobile Association.
Larry Roller, MBS Representative, Host.
